newsitem.title: USA: Phelps Dodge's Chino labor talks unresolved.
newsitem.headline: Phelps Dodge's Chino labor talks unresolved.

text.p: Phelps Dodge Corp and United Steelworkers of America union failed to resolve their labor talks deadlock despite a further round of discussions Friday, the company said.
"The Chino talks ended Friday evening and there has been no resolution," said Phelps spokeswoman Sue Suver.
Unionized employees at the 170,000-tonne-per-year contained copper mine in New Mexico have been working without a contract since June 30.
Suver said that on Friday the union sought a six-year contract, with a pay hike in the fifth and sixth year.
Union officials were not immediately available for comment.
Phelps rejected the union's proposal and said its four-year pay-freeze offer made at the end of August was final, Suver said.

"The company is standing behind its final offer," Suver said. "We have suggested to the union we would like a response to the offer we put on the table on August 22, and there have been no dates, either deadlines nor a date to resume discussions. We are waiting for the union to respond."
Suver said Chino was working at "100 percent production".
Earlier Monday, Phelps said a week-long strike at its Candelaria mine in Chile was over with little production disrupted.
